channel.title: Iran's secert nuclear Bases
channel.description:
So what do you think will come of that? will will just end up bombing the country to get rid of them Discuss don't flame me
source : http://www.guardian.co.uk/world/2009/sep/25/iran-secret-underground-nuclear-plant

item.title: Iran's secert nuclear Bases
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Frell:

Take your own advice, please.

I had no advice. Was simply pointing out that being ignorant and then, when asked what you meant saying “I live there” is pretty dumb.

item.title: Iran's secert nuclear Bases
item.dc:creator: @akl akl
item.description:
@akl wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:64, topic:308063”][quote author=akl link=topic=404148.msg3003792#msg3003792 date=1256229811]

Then google it, we gave Saddam WMDs to fight someone else (dont remember who it was) so we know they have them and he was hiding them. After 9/11 was linked back to him we had to get the misssiles before he did something, or we would be blamed for giving them to him in the first place. (General example) What if we didnt go in for them and they shot them at the UK. Ofc you guys would blame America. The UN even asked Saddam for the missiles and Saddam ignored them all.

Why then blame Saddam for producing WMDs and storing them in Iraq, the streamline reason as to why he was hanged.
If it was America who provided it to him, shouldn’t the Bush Administration blamed for providing it to him in the first place? What liabilities were there that he wouldn’t exploit these?
[/quote]
He didn’t produce the WMD’s…

Ill give more info on why we gave them to him in the first place when i get home.[/quote]
I never said he did, I said he was accused of exploiting them and was then accused of producing WMDs.

Read full topic

item.title: Iran's secert nuclear Bases
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Offering the official administration response to FOX News, a senior Defense Department official pointed out that the chemical weapons were not in useable conditions.

“This does not reflect a capacity that was built up after 1991,” the official said, adding the munitions “are not the WMDs this country and the rest of the world believed Iraq had, and not the WMDs for which this country went to war.”

Read full topic

item.title: Iran's secert nuclear Bases
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

The definition of ‘weapons of mass destruction’:

(1) Any explosive, incendiary, poison gas, bomb, grenade, or rocket having a propellant charge of more than four ounces [113 g], missile having an explosive or incendiary charge of more than one-quarter ounce [7 g], or mine or device similar to the above. (2) Poison gas. (3) Any weapon involving a disease organism. (4) Any weapon that is designed to release radiation at a level dangerous to human life.

This means that I can make a WMD in my shed. According to some definitions, small firearms are WMD’s too because of the number of deaths because of them. I highly disagree with anyone saying that the presence of ‘WMDs’ is a good reason to attack a country.

Read full topic

@MujaheD wrote:

No WMDs were found. America did supply Iraq with missiles, not WMDs. They supplied them with short range missiles, which the Iraqis then modified, making them capable of reaching Israel etc.

Read full topic

item.title: Iran's secert nuclear Bases
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“MujaheD, post:48, topic:308063”]America invaded Iraq because of it’s nuclear weapons? America is the only country in the world to ever use a nuclear weapon in war.

There was no evidence of WMDs in Iraq, yet America was so eager to rape the country. So why did they invade Iraq? It obviously wasn’t for oil, considering America’s current economic situation. The only benefit was for the protection and security of Israel - an Illegal state that was primarily founded by stealing land. Tens of thousands of American soldiers lost their lives to ensure that Jewish European settlers could safely steal land.

Why does America care about Israel? It’s government is made up of Christian extremists who insist on the existence of a Jewish state. Solely because in Christianity, a Jewish state must exist before their awaited messiah may return. A Christian version of Zionism if you like. (Anyone see the double standards? Yet they claim to be fighting religious extremism)

As for the argument of ‘spreading democracy’. The American puppet governments in Iraq and Afghanistan are known to be of the most corrupt governments in the world.

As for the topic, I don’t think America is at all capable of fighting Iran. I expect that Israel will bomb it’s reactors just like they did previously in Iraq, probably sometime in march next year.

I agree with R.I.P RSC:

[quote author=R.I.P RSC link=topic=404148.msg2993650#msg2993650 date=1255449461]

We are in Iraq and Afghanistan for many reasons. Iraq seemed pretty fucking pointless imo. Afghanistan is different. We are helping them to get their country back on their feet, and to have control of their citizens and rid the country of terror. And to also spread democracy. In all; we’re all fucked up atm.

It’s the same as Muslims trying to spread their religion in the US. Theoretically it’s possible, but not by force and in a short period. You can spread your version of democracy in Afghanistan, but not by destroying the pillars the nation is leaning on. You have to do it slowly.

BTW, why ‘rid Afghanistan of terror’, but do nothing in other country’s that are Anti-America? The US government is trying to make us believe that North-Korea is ‘bad’ and is making a nuclear weapon. A nuclear weapon is a bigger threat then a bunch of unorganized and badly equipped donkey-riders. If I were to choose between an enemy with donkeys and homemade bombs or a nation with the alleged ability to fire a nuclear weapon at me or my allies, I’d attack the latter. Unless I just have a big mouth and no balls.
[/quote][/quote]
No evidence? WE GAVE THEM THE MISSILES

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:49, topic:308063”]Mopman isn’t trustworthy :P.

@Frell: you say that Saddam had WMD’s. But did they ever find any? I doubt it. You say that Saddam was linked to Al-Qaeda. But wasn’t it the CIA who gave them weapons?

I find it odd that many nations, not just the US, support the invasion of Afghanistan and Iraq, yet they only verbally disapprove the atrocities in Africa. Why’s that? We send peace forces to Africa, but we send heavily armed forces to Iraq.[/quote]
Yes we found them…

Read full topic

Read full topic

Yet they claim to be fighting religious extremism)

As for the argument of ‘spreading democracy’. The American puppet governments in Iraq and Afghanistan are known to be of the most corrupt governments in the world.

As for the topic, I don’t think America is at all capable of fighting Iran. I expect that Israel will bomb it’s reactors just like they did previously in Iraq, probably sometime in march next year.

I agree with R.I.P RSC:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:21, topic:308063”][quote author=fellixombc link=topic=404148.msg2993113#msg2993113 date=1255396675]
We are in Iraq and Afghanistan for many reasons. Iraq seemed pretty fucking pointless imo. Afghanistan is different. We are helping them to get their country back on their feet, and to have control of their citizens and rid the country of terror. And to also spread democracy. In all; we’re all fucked up atm.
[/quote]

It’s the same as Muslims trying to spread their religion in the US. Theoretically it’s possible, but not by force and in a short period. You can spread your version of democracy in Afghanistan, but not by destroying the pillars the nation is leaning on. You have to do it slowly.

BTW, why ‘rid Afghanistan of terror’, but do nothing in other country’s that are Anti-America? The US government is trying to make us believe that North-Korea is ‘bad’ and is making a nuclear weapon. A nuclear weapon is a bigger threat then a bunch of unorganized and badly equipped donkey-riders. If I were to choose between an enemy with donkeys and homemade bombs or a nation with the alleged ability to fire a nuclear weapon at me or my allies, I’d attack the latter.
